result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Fuller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J Fuller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J Fuller was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Michael J Fuller was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:38 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael J Fuller in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Michael J Fuller.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Christian is heard on sentencing agreement. 
State confirms agreement. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a Guilty plea. Court accepts the defendants Guilty plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

Ct1 - 961.41(1m)(e)3 - Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>10-50g) (1) AMEND to Simple Possession - 961.41(3g)(g) - Possession of Methamphetamine (1) Guilty 
Ct2 - 961.42(1) - Maintain Drug Trafficking Place (1) Guilty 
Ct3 - 961.573(1) - Possess Drug Paraphernalia (1) (DISMISS) 

State moves to dismiss ct3. Court dismisses ct3. 

State is heard on sentencing recommendations. Recommends 90 days jail as a condition of probation. Participate and follow through with any assessments, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  
Attorney Christian is heard on sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant is heard. 

Court orders: withheld sentence - 2 yrs probation; 90 days conditional jail. Huber/EM approved for the conditional jail. Undergo any assessment deemed appropriate by the DOC. Continue with the AODA. Defendant is to submit to any random testing probation deems appropriate. 1 day jail credit in the event that sentence would be revoked. Report to jail no later than September 26th 2022 at 6:30. Court Costs.
PP approved. $100.00 per month. Commencing October 1st. PPF $15.00

2:20 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Attorney David L. Christian appeared by video for Michael J Fuller.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael J Fuller appeared by video. 
     Atty. Christian states an offer rcvd. and believes resolved; requests a plea/sentencing.
     Court concludes at 2:23 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:27 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael J Fuller appeared by phone.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Michael J Fuller.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Atty. Christian states awaiting test results.  D.A. requests a July date.
     Court concludes at 2:29 p.m.
Jury status hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on July 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:05 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael J Fuller appeared by video.  Attorney David L. Christian appeared by video for Michael J Fuller.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Atty Christian is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:02 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael J Fuller appeared in court, Attorney David L. Christian for Michael J Fuller appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

Atty Christian is heard, client is willing to waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Petition for Leave to File Additional Motions

records.addlTxt:
1:46 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael J Fuller appeared in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. 
Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

11:31 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael J Fuller appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

DA requests a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Def comments. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises the right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
